utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Monica, why are we watchin' the business channel?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: 'Cause I was going by it the other day and I saw that there was a stock with my initials, MEG, on it and, well, sometimes I have to watch for two or three hours before it comes up again but when it does, it's pretty exciting.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok honey, you really need a job.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Mon, speaking of which, dad says he knows someone you can call for an interview.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, right there. That, that's the third sign today. Right there.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: On behalf of everyone, I'd just like to say behuh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, 'cause you just said dad and everywhere I go today I keep getting signs telling me to go see my father. Like when I was walking over here and I passed a buffet...which is my father's last name.

utterance.speaker: EVERYONE
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: And they were serving franks which is his first name minus the s at the end. And there was a rotisserie with spinning chicken.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: His indian name?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No because I chickened out the last time when I tried to meet him. So I mean coincidences? I don't think so.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Freakish.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Freaky.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Weird, weird.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, so uh, who wants the last hamburger?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, alright, that's it, now I have to go see him.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hamburger. McDonald's. Old MacDonald had a farm, my dad is a pharmacist.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Man, I am so beat.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, you just wanna forget about raquetball and hang out here?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah alright.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Hey you're in our seats.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, sorry we didn't know.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Hey, we were sitting there.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, there is one more way to say it, who knows it?

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Is that supposed to be funny?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No actually, I was just going for colorful.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: What's with this guy?

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: What's with you?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, nothing, nothing's with him. Enjoy your coffee.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: I just took your hat. See, I can be funny too. My, my joke is that I, I took your hat.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That, that is funny. Can I have it back?

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, ok, you know what? I think you're very funny. Kudos on that hat joke. But, come on guy just, just give him back the hat.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Why should we?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Because it's a special hat. See he bought it 'cause he was feeling really down one day so he got the hat to cheer himself up, ya know. Now Chandler...

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Stop talking, stop talking now. Let me just get this straight. You're actually stealing my hat?

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: You got a problem with that?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, just wanna make sure we're on the same page.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey, how'd the interview go?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It bit. It was a 50's theme restraunt. I have to cook in a costume and dance on the counter. I mean I was a chef at Cafe des Artistes. I mean how could I take a job where I have to make something called Laverne and Curly Fries?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: So don't do it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: How can I not do it? I have $127 in the bank.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Monica, relax, go get a beer.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I don't want a beer.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Who said it was for you?

utterance.speaker: ROSS and CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hhhiiii.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What's the matter with you?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: The mean guys at the coffee house took my hat.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Noo.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You're kiddin'.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: It was ridiculous. Ya know, these guys, they were bullies, actual bullies, ya know. We're grown ups, this kinda stuff isn't supposed to happen anymore.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oohhh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ohhh Oh no, wait a minute, I have no one.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, woah, let's go down there and get your hat back.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Na, forget it, it's probably stripped and sold for parts by now.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey, I went up.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: My stock, MEG, it went up 2 points. Hey guys, do you realize that if I had invested my $127 in myself yesterday that I'd like have...a lot more than that today. Ya know what, I'm gonna do it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Do what?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Put all my money in me.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Monica, what are you talking about? You don't know the first thing about the stock market.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What's to know? Buy sell, high low, bears bulls... Yes Manhattan...yeah telephone number of the stock...selling store.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: See, didn't I tell ya these pillows would be a good idea?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh God, here we go. For the first time in my life I'm gonna say 'Hi birthfather'.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: We love you, we're here for you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah good luck, good luck.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Rach, you uh, you want some sandwich?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ohh, what is in that?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Olive loaf and ham spread, no mayo.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No no, 'cause mayo, that would make it gross.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey, hey, no, oh oh.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Run Phoebe run.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No no no, doggie please. Oh, I do so wanna love all animals, please no.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Get him a bone, get a bone. You gotta bone?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Look kibbles, bits. Oh God, alright, get the hell off my leg you yippity piece of crap. Ok, alright, we have a problem.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well why don't you just reach out and take his trampoline.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, here, I know what we can do.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey no.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, doggie get the- aahhh. Ok go get the sandwich, get the sandwich doggie. Good doggie get the sandwich, get the...ok, Joey, the dog will lick himself but he will not touch your sandwich, what does that say?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well if he's not gonna eat it, I will.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Are you crazy?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Phoebs, he's just a little dog. Ahhh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Do you have to be a Century 21 real-estate agent to get to wear those really cool jackets?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Do you say this stuff to girls?

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Hehehehey, isn't that the guy who used to wear your hat?

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: And look where they're sitting.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You're joking, right? You guys just walked through the door.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Maybe we didn't make it clear enough.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: This couch belongs to us.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, I'll tell you what, you call the couch and then, and then we'll call the couch, and we'll see who it comes to.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: You know what I keep wondering? Why you two are still sitting here.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Alright, that's it. I've had enough of this, alright. Gunther, these guys are trying to take our seat.

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: Fellas, these guys were here first.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Oh, sorry, I didn't realize.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Thank you Gunther. We didn't want to have to go and do that.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: He told on us?

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: You told on us?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well pal, you didn't give me much of a choice.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Don't play with his things.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Alright, let's take this outside.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Let's, let's take this outside? Who talks like that?

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: The guy that's about to kick your ass talks like that.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You had to ask.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, ok look, see, the thing is we're, we're not gonna fight you guys.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Well then here's the deal, you won't have to so long as never ever show your faces in this coffee house ever again.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I think you played the Gunther card too soon.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Phoeb's, I think you're good to go.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, I don't know.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I just think that this was a really bad sign, ya know. I mean, like the beast at the threshold, you know. It's just like, I have no family left, ya know. I mean except for my grandmother, you know, but let's face it, she's not gonna be around forever, despite what she says. And I have a sister who I've barely spoken to since we like shared a womb. I don't know, this is my real father and I just, I want things to be like just right.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah Phoebe, I completely understand.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, whatever you need. Hey, you wanna go home?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, thanks. Sorry, again

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uhh, I'm guessing the threshold's clear now.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I wanna buy 5 shares of SGJ and I wanna buy them now. C'mon time is money my friend. Thank you. Wooo.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Time is money my friend?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, you missed, 'Takes money to make money,' and uh, 'Don't make me come down there and kick your wall street butt.'

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey, I made $17 before breakfast, what have you done?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well uh, I had breakfast here so technically I saved $3.50.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: How did you make $17.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, my financially challenged friends, I split my money and I bought some shares of CHP and ZXY.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How come those?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, CHP because I used to have a crush on Eric Estrada. And ZXY becuase I think it sounds zexy.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What happened to uh, MEG.?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: MEG was good for me but I dumped her. Ya know, my motto is get out before they go down.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: That is so not my motto.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey Phoebs. Oh hey, how's the dog?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, I talked to the vet, people are so nice upstate. Anyway, he said that the little fella's gonna be ok and I can pick him up tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, but he did have to have a bunch of stitches and he said that only once in a blue moon does a dog's ear grow back so...still hoping.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, so Phoebe, now are you gonna call your dad and let him know that his dog is ok?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I, I don't wanna meet my father over the phone. What am I gonna say, like 'Hi, I'm Phoebe, the daughter you abandoned. Oh, by the way, I broke your dog.'

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Phoebs, if you want, I'll do it.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok. Listen, just don't say anything about me, ok.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: DON'T...be too long with the phone.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: She'll be a much better friend when the market closes.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It's a woman.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: So talk to her.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uhh, hello Miss Buffay. I know where your dog is. I want you to know that he'll be returned to you, almost as good as new, within, within 24 hours. Uh, goodbye.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Why the voice.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hard to say.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Your cappucino sir.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ya know I think this is much better than the coffee house.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: How come it's not mixing with the water?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, this is ridiculous. I'll tell you what. After I get back from my neice's christening, I'll go down to the coffee house with you and we'll all have a nice cup of coffee alright. No problem, Joey's there.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No. Man I don't wanna have to have Joey with me every time I wanna descent cup of coffee. Ya know, and I don't wanna spend the rest of my life drinking cappucino with a 'K'. I say you and I go back down there and stand up to those guys.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, hang on a second there Custer.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah really, Ross, have you ever been beaten up before?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: By someone besides Monica?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No. So what. So what if we get beaten up, maybe that's just something every man has to go through once in his life. Ya know, like a, like a right of passage or somethin'.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, couldn't we just lose our virginities again? Ya know, because I think actually mine's growing back.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I need to borrow a hundred bucks.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hi, welcome home. I need to borrow a hundred bucks.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I've gotta get back in the game.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Why, when did you get out of the game?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I don't know, I lost it all ok. I lost it.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hey, I've come to terms with it, you have to too.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok. Look uhh, Mon I'm, I'm really sorry.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, where are we on the hundred bucks?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I, I don't have it.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: But I need it. Otherwords I'm gonna have to take that horrible diner job. You know, with the dancing and the costumes. I don't wanna have to wear flame retardant boobs.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Nobody does honey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: MRS BUFFAY
utterance.content: Schnoodle. Oh my God, what the hell happened to my dog?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It was an accident, and, and the woman who did this would never ever hurt a dog on purpose. She's a vegetarian.

utterance.speaker: MRS BUFFAY
utterance.content: What are these, stitches?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, eight of them. That's 56 to him. You know also, if, if it's raining, you can't let him look up too long 'cause that cone'll fill up really really fast.

utterance.speaker: MRS BUFFAY
utterance.content: Yeah well, thanks for bringing back what's left of him.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Sure, oh, is, is Frank home.

utterance.speaker: MRS BUFFAY
utterance.content: How do you know Frank?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Just from a, from a long time ago. Is he here?

utterance.speaker: MRS BUFFAY
utterance.content: Yeah. Frank.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah. What?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, ok, um, I mean Frank senior.

utterance.speaker: MRS BUFFAY
utterance.content: He went out for groceries.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok so will he be back soon?

utterance.speaker: MRS BUFFAY
utterance.content: Well he left four years ago so we're expecting him back any minute now.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright, I'm, I'm gonna go. I'm sorry about the dog, everything. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Hey lady. Hey wait up. How do you know my dad?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um well I don't really. Just genetically. He's kinda my dad too.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Heavy.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah. So um, did he ever talk about me, Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No but he didn't really talk about anything.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Except stilts.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Stilts?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah, he loved stilts. One time I was upstairs, I was stealing cigarettes out of my mom's purse, and uh, all of a sudden I look over and there's my dad's head bobbing past the window. He just had this big smile on his face and he was waving 'cause he was always happiest when he was on his stilts.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I don't know what to do with that.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Me neither. So you're like my big sister.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: This is huge, you can buy me beer.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm not gonna. But you know what's cool though? Ok, if you had a friend named Pete, then I could say, 'Oh yeah, I know Pete, he's friends with my brother.'

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I gotta friend named Mark.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: That'll work too.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Cool, alright. So maybe, ya know, I could give you a call sometime, we could talk or somethin'.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, that'd be ok.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, I'm in the book.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Ok, yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright. So um, stilts huh?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah hey, you know if you want I can take you around back and show you where he hit his head on the rain gutter.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well we did it, we're here. We are standing our ground. How long does a cup of coffee take?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Would you come on! Come on! Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ah, there we go.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I think we proved our point.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You burn your mouth?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Cannot feel my tounge.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Bullies, big bullies.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Oh, look who's here, it's the weenies.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Did we not make ourselves clear the other day.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yes, and that's why we're here.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes, we're standing out ground...apparently.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Let's do this alright.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Woah, ho-ho, whad'ya got there, a weapon?

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: It's a nice watch, I don't wanna break it on your ribs.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright, let's do this.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Question. If I don't care about my watch, can I use it as a weapon?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Whad'ya mean?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, it's sharp, it's metal, I think I can do some, you know, serious damage with it.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: No, you can't use your watch.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Or your keys.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: LITTLE BULLY
utterance.content: Look, here's what we'll do. We'll put all keys and watches in the hat over there. Alright. Alright, c'mon man, let's do this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Before I forget, are we hitting faces?

utterance.content: Ok, nothing from the neck up. Or the waist down. Dana's ovulating.

utterance.content: Us, what about you guys? Man you really, bing, gave it to old Mr. Clean back there. He was a big guy.

utterance.content: Yeah he was wasn't he.

utterance.content: Yeah, I wouldn't know having missed everything.

utterance.speaker: BIG BULLY
utterance.content: Don't do that to yourself. Any one of us could have tripped over that little girls jump-rope.

utterance.content: So, listen guys, are we uh, are we ok here?
